author: Andrés Romaña
title: Ministerio de Justicia advierte "retroceso" por demanda que busca eliminar la extinción de domino | Peru 21
text: Ministerio de Justicia advierte "retroceso" por demanda que busca eliminar la extinción de domino Institución asegura que, gracias a la extinción de dominio, el Estado ha recuperado más de S/ 250 millones. El [Ministerio de Justicia y Derechos Humanos](https://peru21.pe/noticias/ministerio-de-justicia/) emitió un comunicado en el que alerta sobre la eliminación de la norma de extinción de domino. En ese sentido, cuestionó que el defensor del pueblo, [Josué Gutiérrez](https://peru21.pe/noticias/josue-gutierrez), haya presentado una demanda de de inconstitucionalidad contra la norma. A través de su cuenta X, el Minjus aseguró que "esta demanda tendría incidencia directa contra las entidades beneficiarias como el Poder judicial, la Policía Nacional y las Procuradurías Públicas, así como la operatividad del Programa Nacional de Bienes Incautados (Probnabi), en la lucha contra la criminalidad y delitos graves que ellos desarrollan". MIRA: [Carlos Zeballos dejará bancada Podemos Perú: "Mi decisión ya está tomada"](https://peru21.pe/politica/carlos-zeballos-dejara-bancada-podemos-peru-mi-decision-ya-esta-tomada/) "La eliminación de la extinción de dominio afectaría todo lo avanzado en el marco de la lucha contra la criminalidad y delitos graves", señala. Asimismo, expresó su "preocupación por la demanda presentada por la Defensoría del Pueblo" e hizo un llamado a esta institución para que "vele preferentemente por los derechos de la ciudadanía sobre otros intereses evidenciados en la objeción sobre la viabilidad de esta importante figura". "Los procesos de extinción de dominio han permitido recuperar, a favor del Estado peruano, más de S/ 250 millones de soles en activos, bienes o ganancias producto de actividades ilícitas vinculadas con el crimen organizado, que tienen como fin último la obtención de beneficios económicos y la explotación de mercados ilegales", indica el documento. Por último, el Minjus indica que confía "en la labor ponderada del Tribunal Constitucional" para que interprete la Constitución "beneficio de todos los peruanos". La demanda El 2 de agosto el defensor del pueblo, Josué Gutiérrez, presentó una demanda de inconstitucionalidad ante el Tribunal Constitucional contra doce artículos del Decreto Legislativo 1373 que regula la figura de extinción de domino. "Interponemos demanda de inconstitucionalidad contra el numeral 2.1, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5, 2.9, 3.10 del artículo II del Título Preliminar, así como los artículos 7.1.b, 7.1.f, 31.2, 32, 34 y 44 del Decreto Legislativo 1373, Decreto Legislativo sobre extinción de dominio, por vulnerar el derecho de propiedad (artículos 2.16 y 70 de la Constitución), el principio de tipicidad (artículo 2.24.d de la Constitución), principio de presunción de inocencia (artículo 2.24.e de la Constitución), el principio de irretroactividad de la ley (artículo 103 de la Constitución) y el principio de seguridad jurídica (artículos 2.24.a) y 2.24.d) y el artículo 139.3 de la Constitución)", indica el documento. En la demanda aparecen como demandados la presidenta Dina Boluarte y los miembros de su gabinete. [¡Aprovecha el cyber AQUÍ y recibe nuestro periódico digital desde S/ 54 por todo un año!](https://epaper.peru21.pe/) VIDEO RECOMENDADO

author: Georgie Abay
title: Georgie Abay May editor's letter | marie claire
text: I thought my career would be over when I had children. I was 30 when I had my first, 31 with my second. I’d spent a decade slowly hiking my way up the mastheads of women’s fashion magazines only to get close to the top and fall off the mountain. I’d had two babies back-to-back, a very difficult second pregnancy and birth, and I couldn’t do it all. I know I’m not the only one who has had children and felt like their career is over. [ The motherhood penalty ](https://www.marieclaire.com.au/life/economists-glass-ceiling-index-2024/)(the phenomenon by which women’s pay decreases once they become mothers) is the real deal. I’ve felt it and chances are if you’ve had children so have you. In Australia, the value of unpaid childcare work is about $345 billion, which makes it nearly three times larger than the financial and insurance sector combined. The burden of providing this care falls disproportionately on women. For every hour of unpaid care work done by men, women do one hour and 48 minutes. No one is immune from the motherhood penalty, not even our [May cover star, actor Kirsten Dunst,](https://www.marieclaire.com.au/news/kirsten-dunst-interview-civil-war/) whose new film [Civil War](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt17279496/), is out now. At 42, she is undeniably one of the most accomplished actors in Hollywood, and yet, by her own admission, since she became a mother (of two boys: Ennis, five, and James, two) she’s dealt with being typecast. Motherhood, coupled with entering her 40s, was challenging. “Every role I was being offered was the sad mom,” she tells marie claire. “The hardest thing is being a mom and … feeling like I have nothing for myself. That’s every mother – not just me.” I feel insecure like a normal woman, but I also have a good head on my shouldersKirsten Dunst Dunst is someone who strikes me as having perspective beyond her years. “I feel insecure like a normal woman, but I also have a good head on my shoulders,” she says. This is her first interview – and role – in two years. Reading her words, it feels like the most vulnerable and honest she’s ever been. At marie claire, we use the power of storytelling to drive connection because, ultimately, we want you to feel less alone. At our annual [International Women’s Day event](https://www.marieclaire.com.au/news/marie-claire-international-womens-day-lunch/), in partnership with Pandora and supported by Napoleon, in early March, I was reminded of the power of connection. And I don’t mean digital connection (because personally I don’t ever feel truly connected online) I mean the bonds you create when you are meeting people face-to-face and sharing failures and triumphs. For our IWD lunch, I interviewed five extraordinary women: federal MP Tanya Plibersek and her daughter Anna Coutts-Trotter, who is the founder of [ The Survivor Hub](https://www.thesurvivorhub.org.au/) (a charity organisation supporting people who have been impacted by sexual abuse); media personality, author and presenter Melissa Leong; entrepreneur and author Erin Deering; and British author and podcaster Elizabeth Day (her [ How To Fail podcast](https://go.skimresources.com?id=105419X1625120&xs=1&xcust=MC&url=https%3A%2F%2Fpodcasts.apple.com%2Fgb%2Fpodcast%2Fhow-to-fail-with-elizabeth-day%2Fid1407451189) is downloaded by more than a million people every month, and given she has been in my ears for many years, it was a total joy to interview her in person). You can read my wrap-up [here. ](https://www.marieclaire.com.au/life/everything-our-editor-learnt-at-marie-claires-international-womens-day-event/) There really is so much to love in our new issue. If like me, you’re a fan of high-waisted pants, we’ve searched high and low for the best styles. And if you’re a skincare junkie, our beauty team has created an A-Z guide on the latest trends. As we move into the cooler months, I’m also loving the prepiness of all the rugby tops out there (see my favourite three below). Georgie wears camilla and marc blazer, and pants. Viktoria Woods shirt. Shop the look below. Finally, marie claire strives to spark change, which is why we are thrilled to announce the launch of our inaugural marie claire Sustainability Awards, in partnership with Volvo. A celebration of brands that prioritise both people and planet, these awards will champion businesses and products that are implementing genuine change and building a better tomorrow. There will be more to come on this exciting new initiative, so stay tuned. Georgie x What I’m Currently Loving… 01 camilla and marc Patterson Blazer $800 at [The Iconic](https://iconic.prf.hn/click/camref:1101liQ3t/pubref:MC/destination:https://www.theiconic.com.au/patterson-blazer-2256675.html) Introducing the Patterson Blazer in steel grey: a must-have staple that embodies modern sophistication in a timeless grey hue. Its longline, single-breasted design exudes polished elegance, effortlessly blending classic and contemporary aesthetics. Available at: - $800 from [camilla and marc](https://iconic.prf.hn/click/camref:1101liQ3t/pubref:MC/destination:https://www.theiconic.com.au/patterson-blazer-2256675.html) - $800 from [David Jones](https://davidjones.k98d.net/c/3001951/378291/5504?subId1=MC&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.davidjones.com%2Fproduct%2Fcamilla-and-marc-patterson-blazer-26531649) - $800 from [The Iconic](https://iconic.prf.hn/click/camref:1101liQ3t/pubref:MC/destination:https://www.theiconic.com.au/patterson-blazer-2256675.html) 02 camilla and marc Patterson Pant $450 at [The Iconic](https://iconic.prf.hn/click/camref:1101liQ3t/pubref:MC/destination:https://www.theiconic.com.au/patterson-blazer-2256675.html) The Patterson Pant is a must-have in any modern wardrobe, seamlessly blending style and comfort in a versatile grey shade. author: 中國報
title: 国会动态｜30电子垃圾回收厂非法营业 设偏僻地区 躲执法 | 中國報 China Press
text:
（吉隆坡6日讯）天然资源及环境永续部长聂纳兹米说，环境局早前连同警方在全国各地展开“Ops Hazard”执法行动，突击检查47家涉嫌进口非法电子垃圾的回收厂，并充公1万5764.9公吨总值约5500万令吉的电子垃圾。
他说，上述47家回收厂中，有30家非法营运、7家为废铁回收厂、6家是在环境局下注册营运执照的回收厂、3家持地方政府发出营运执照的工厂，以及1间非法仓库。
他也说，为了避开执法人员视线，这些回收厂大部分都设立在远离市区和工业区的地方，例如马来保留地、油棕园和森林内。
“这些回收厂大部分都是非法经营，没有获得地方政府发出的营运执照，且所聘请的工人多为偷渡入境的非法外劳。
“这47家回收厂均已在1974年环境素质法令下被调查，其中37家回收厂用于处理电子垃圾的机器已被执法当局扣押，有关当局也向这些回收厂发出59张违例通知和27张罚单。”
聂纳兹米今日在国会下议院部长问答环节，如是回答伊斯兰党士兆国会议员祖基尔乃阿都卡迪尔的提问。
他说，执法当局也已开启52个调查档案展开深入调查这些回收厂，调查完成后，将移交总检察署展开司法程序。
武吉阿曼内部安全及公共秩序局总监拿督阿兹米上个月召开记者会指出，警方在过去一年联合环境局在全国各地积极突击非法电子垃圾回收厂，逮捕538名本地和外籍男女，并起获价值高达38亿令吉的电子垃圾。

author: #5791 wgs
title: 五国制裁以色列两部长 引发多方反对_军事频道_中华网
text:
据哥伦比亚广播公司报道，英国、澳大利亚、加拿大、新西兰和挪威联合宣布制裁以色列两名极右翼部长——国家安全部长伊塔马尔·本-格维尔和财政部长比撒列·斯莫特里赫。五国指责两人多次煽动针对约旦河西岸巴勒斯坦人的暴力事件，并采取了冻结资产和禁止入境等措施。依据英国政府网站发布的五国外长联合声明，制裁只针对在五国看来“破坏以色列自身安全和国际声望”的个人。
斯莫特里赫定居于约旦河西岸，亲自授意以色列定居者扩张领土，甚至扬言不会让任何物资进入加沙地带。本-格维尔曾因煽动种族主义和支持恐怖组织获罪，从政前专为受控恐怖主义犯罪的以色列犹太人辩护。他下令突袭耶路撒冷老城的阿克萨清真寺，并要求巴勒斯坦人离开加沙地带。尽管如此，声明强调此次制裁仅针对个人，五国依然希望保持与以色列民众的友好联系，并表示无法将定居者在约旦河西岸的暴行与加沙地带灾难分开看待。
对于这些制裁，包括本-格维尔、斯莫特里赫和前国防部长本尼·甘茨在内的多名以色列政要迅速表态反对。以色列外交部长萨尔称五国行动“无法容忍”，并表示政府将在下周初召开特别会议商讨应对措施。美国国务卿鲁比奥也谴责了五国的制裁，呼吁撤销无助于美国斡旋加沙停火的制裁，提醒伙伴们不要忘记真正的敌人是谁。
此外，以色列总理内塔尼亚胡表示，确保释放加沙剩余人质的努力已取得重大进展，但目前期待达成协议还为时尚早。他在办公室分享的视频声明中并未提供细节。消息人士透露，美国正以推动战争结束的举措向哈马斯提供更多保证，但持乐观态度的是美国官员而非以色列方面。

author: world today news
title: Fenerbahce’s Hayes Davies impresses Turkey with Armenian Genocide Post
text:
Fenerbahce basketball team forward Hayes Davis has been targeted by Turks on social media after a post he made about the Armenian genocide.
Hayes Davies visited Yerevan, Armenia and posted pictures of the Armenian Genocide memorial, causing outrage in Turkey. The American Fenerbahce player even had to delete his post, but also move on to new ones, explaining that he did not intend to hurt people.
Post Hayes Davis
“I hear you, but I just went to see the museum. I don’t know enough to start preaching. You already told me that I play basketball in Turkey, so I’m not going to say anything disrespectful. I’m just a tourist with a cameraman. I try to learn as much as I can and be unbiased.
After my post, I realized that the topic I shared about Armenia and Turkey was very sensitive. As much as I try to learn, I don’t know everything. Out of appreciation and respect for what Turkey has given me, personally and professionally, I would like to say that I did not intend to intentionally cause disrespect to Turkey, its history or its citizens.
Those who know me personally and have spoken to me on the matter know that what I say is sincere. I am not Turkish, so I did not understand how serious this issue is for Turks. I hope this clears up any misunderstandings or misinterpretations about my words, actions and especially my character. To tell those who were hurt by this situation that he didn’t mean to hurt them.”
Hayes Davies was one of Fenerbahce’s key players last season.
Follow us for all news on Bing News and Google News

author: Àlex Bustos
title: Putin planteja l’ús d’armes nuclears en cas d’"atac massiu" contra Rússia
text: Putin planteja l’ús d’armes nuclears en cas d’"atac massiu" contra Rússia Moscou modifica la doctrina davant "l’aparició de noves fonts d’amenaces" Moscou segueix de prop les decisions que prenen Ucraïna i els seus aliats i la possible autorització occidental de l’ús de míssils de llarg abast en territori rus no passa desapercebuda. En aquesta clau es llegeix la decisió del president Vladímir Putin d’autoritzar una possible resposta nuclear a un atac "massiu" aeri contra el seu territori durant la reunió del Consell de Seguretat rus, dimecres a la nit. Quan va començar la guerra a Ucraïna el febrer del 2022, el líder del Kremlin va amenaçar en diverses ocasions amb l’ús d’armes atòmiques. Va fer alguns passos per tenir més marge per utilitzar aquest tipus d’armament però no ha arribat mai a fer-lo servir contra objectius ucraïnesos. El portaveu del Kremlin, Dmitri Peskov, va declarar ahir que quan el decret amb la nova doctrina nuclear estigui a punt es farà públic amb tots els detalls. En la reunió del Consell, que va ser parcialment televisada, Putin va declarar que Rússia ha de tenir en compte "l’aparició de noves fonts d’amenaces i riscos militars" per al país euroasiàtic i els seus aliats. "Totes les precisions [de la doctrina nuclear] estan profundament calibrades i d’acord amb les amenaces i riscos militars moderns contra la Federació de Rússia", va afegir. A més de plantejar una resposta nuclear a atacs contra el seu territori, el nou decret estableix que si un país no nuclear ataca Rússia recolzat per un Estat que sí que té armament atòmic, aquest es vegi com un atac conjunt. Això implicaria, per exemple, que si Ucraïna bombardeja Rússia avalada pel Regne Unit, els EUA o França, aquests països serien considerats cobel·ligerants. Putin va remarcar que les armes nuclears russes són actualment "la garantia més gran de seguretat per a l’Estat i els seus ciutadans". Segons Peskov, la doctrina nuclear és un tema que no es tocava des de fa un any. Rússia, antigament signant junt amb els EUA del tractat New Start de reducció d’armes nuclears, va sortir de l’acord el febrer del 2023 amb l’argument que quan es va rubricar, el 2010, Washington no era adversari de Moscou. També va remarcar que perquè fos just s’havia d’incloure l’armament nuclear d’altres països de l’OTAN. Des d’aleshores el Kremlin ha utilitzat l’amenaça nuclear en algunes ocasions, la més destacada el maig del 2024, quan va fer maniobres amb equip nuclear a prop de la frontera amb Ucraïna. Notícies relacionades"Acabar la paciència" Alguns barons russos ja han demanat l’ús d’armes nuclears contra Ucraïna en el marc de la guerra. Un d’ells és el governador de Txetxènia, Ramzan Kadírov, que l’octubre del 2022 va instar els comandaments militars a utilitzar armes atòmiques de càrrega baixa. Des de la televisió pública algunes veus habituals en les amenaces contra Ucraïna també han demanat accions similars tant contra Kíiv com contra països aliats del país eslau. Fins i tot el vicepresident de la Duma, Piotr Tolstoi, va parlar de quant trigaria un míssil nuclear a arribar a París. El vicepresident del Consell de Seguretat i expresident rus, Dmitri Medvédev, va advertir recentment que a Moscou "se li podia acabar la paciència". - [Els Mossos abaten un home que els va disparar davant la comissaria de Reus](https://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/societat/20240925/els-mossos-abaten-home-els-108537309) - [Mèxic i Espanya s’embranquen en una crisi diplomàtica per la insolència al Rei](https://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/internacional/20240925/mexic-espanya-s-embranquen-crisi-108582831) - [Un professor dels Maristes, acusat de violar una alumna](https://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/societat/20240925/professor-dels-maristes-acusat-violar-108582708) - [L’extint Llobregat Centre donarà pas a 300 nous habitatges](https://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/barcelona/20240925/l-extint-llobregat-centre-donara-108579983) - [La premsa holandesa publica les fotos de Bárbara Rey i Joan Carles I besant-se](https://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/oci-i-cultura/20240925/premsa-holandesa-publica-les-fotos-108579137)

author: Guardian Nigeria
title: The evil scriptwriters - Part 5 | The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News — Sunday Magazine — The Guardian Nigeria News – Nigeria and World News
text: The evil scriptwriters – Part 5 If the devil captures men of destiny, he gives them no room to repent, but hastens their mistakes and consequences to lead to untimely death. That was exactly what he did to Samson and King Saul in the Bible. In Ruth 1:3-5, we see a similar situation in the family of Elimelech and Naomi. The men all died untimely because the devil made them to take wrong decisions in life that was contrary to God’s original plan for them. By this, the evil scriptwriters write the obituary of men. It is important to note that whenever the enemy wants to write the obituary of men there are certain things that happen. First of them all, the victim begins to dream of dead relatives or friends. He/she may also dream of obituary, seeing his/her own obituary posters all over the place and even being in the ceremony and seeing one’s self lying-in-state in a coffin. Again, the victim may always dream of coffin and seeing him/herself covered with black cloth. Another thing that happens is that the victim’s ears become deafened to divine instructions or godly counsel. At this point, whatever advice you give to such a person is never accepted, rather the heart is set to go in its own way of error. Finally, the enemy will give him direction that will eventually lead to his untimely demise. This was the case with the family of Naomi in Ruth 1:3-5. They could not endure a little period of famine in Bethlehem and so they set out to Moab, a cursed land with people of perverted practices. God had no plan for them in such a place. Leaving Bethlehem, which means, “House of Bread” to Moab was the worst mistake this family ever made. Moab, at this time, was a flourishing city filled with immorality and idolatry. Anyone could be tempted to run there, especially in the time of lack and great suffering, as was experienced in Bethlehem, but understand that not all that glitters is gold. Often times, when we are faced with such situations, God wants us to trust and depend on Him, rather than follow our human reasoning. It is time to listen to what God is saying and not allow our ugly situation give us direction. In Moab, Naomi lost her husband and two sons. She returned to Bethlehem empty when she heard that the famine was over. Prov. 14:12 says there is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof is the way of death. The evil scriptwriters write the obituary of men and so book an appointment with untimely death to tally with their already prepared obituary plan. There are different strategies or mode of operations used to carry out their plans. One of them is by breaking your fellowship with God. They can stop you from praying and you are no longer eager to commune with God. They can also stop you from attending fellowship, using different excuses like being tired, busy, lack of transport means to the fellowship centre and so on. All of these can bring a spiritual gap between you and God, thereby giving room for the evil scriptwriters to operate in your life. May God frustrate their strategies over you in Jesus’ name. Prayer Points • Any power writing my obituary in the spirit realm, catch fire in Jesus’ name. • Every appointment with untimely death in my life and family, be cancelled in Jesus’ name. • Evil harvesters of soul, get out of my life and family Jesus’ name. • Problems assigned to lead me to make wrong decisions in life, expire by fire, in Jesus’ name. • O Lord, whatever I have lost as a result of my past mistake, restore them all by your mercies. • Father, by your mercy, return me from every wrong path I am treading upon right now in Jesus’ name. • O Lord, renew my fellowship with you in Jesus’ name. author: Alba Carnicé
title: Auroras boreales en Barcelona este viernes: espectaculares imágenes a una hora de la ciudad
text:
Catalunya ha registrado este viernes, 11 de octubre, de madrugada auroras boreales , que se han avistado en el cielo nocturno desde varios puntos de Barcelona y de Tarragona alejados de la luz de las ciudades, como en los observatorios astronómicos de Pujalt y de Castelltallat.
El fenómeno de las auroras boreales se produce en episodios de alta actividad solar cuando el astro emite intensos flujos de partículas y que, en contacto con la Tierra , son atrapadas por su campo magnético produciendo este efecto visual.
Aurora boreal desde el Observatorio de Castelltallat LORENA SOPEÑA - EUROPA PRESS
No es normal presenciar este fenómeno en Catalunya, ya que suele ocurrir en latitudes más al norte. Pero ¿por qué estamos viendo auroras boreales? Esto se debe a que la actividad solar está alcanzando su punto máximo , el cual se espera para el próximo año, en un ciclo que se repite aproximadamente cada 11 años.
Aurora boreal desde el Observatori de Pujalt LORENA SOPEÑA - EUROPA PRESS
Esta situación ha provocado que últimamente las tormentas solares lancen gran cantidad de partículas solares hacia la Tierra, lo que genera auroras boreales en zonas poco habituales, como en latitudes más bajas.
Tal y como se puede observar en las imágenes publicadas por el Observatori de Pujalt en las redes sociales, el espectáculo ha sido extraordinario. Sin embargo, este fenómeno no se va a repetir esta noche . Según informa el Observatori, en las próximas horas bajará la intensidad auroral y hacia el anochecer sólo serán localizables en países ubicados hacia el norte de Europa.
Recordem que la situació que vam tenir ahir a la nit d’observació d’aurores va ser única i que aquesta nit ja no tindrem. Aquesta nit ja no s’observaràn aurores, ja que tota la bombolla que les ha generat ja s’ha “desfet". pic.twitter.com/ybTNf4qdNK
— Observatori de Pujalt (@Observatori) October 11, 2024 Així estem observant aurores amb cameres de mòbil en aquests moments, amb més de 200 persones que s'han apropat a l'observatori durant aquesta nit. pic.twitter.com/A40c0wWzYS
— Observatori de Pujalt (@Observatori) October 10, 2024 Metrópoli recomienda: Las playas de Barcelona vibran con la Copa América para atraer el foco internacional
FOTOGALERÍA: Así ha sido el mayor espectáculo de drones de Europa por la Copa América...
El Govern desencalla el proyecto para recuperar las urgencias médicas nocturnas...
El nuevo Port Olímpic de Barcelona esconde una escultura histórica de los JJOO
Un 'escape room' muestra la cara amarga de la soledad en las personas mayores

author: ANI
title: Ram Mandir event: List of rituals, events in Ayodhya from January 16-22
text: India On January 22, Shri Ram will be seated in his divinely grand temple in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. As the preparations for the consecration ceremony of Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram Temple are going on at a fast pace, the ritual process will continue on a large scale for seven days in Ayodhya, which will start on January 16. The deity of Shri Ram Lalla (Lord Ram in his childlike form) will be consecrated on 22nd January. On January 22, Shri Ram will be seated in his divinely grand temple in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The seven-day schedule released by the Temple Trust has the following events: January 16: Atonement by the host appointed by the temple trust, Dashavid bath on the banks of river Saryu, Vishnu worship and Godan. January 17: Procession will visit Ayodhya with the idol of Ramlala, devotees will reach the temple carrying Saryu water in Mangal Kalash. January 18: Formal rituals will start with Ganesh Ambika Puja, Varun Puja, Matrika Puja, Brahmin Varan, Vastu Puja etc. January 19: Agni Sthapana, Navagraha Sthapana and Havan. January 20: After washing the sanctum sanctorum of the temple with the holy water of Saryu, there will be Vaastu Shanti and Annadhivas. January 21: After a divine bath with 125 urns, Shayadhivas will be done. January 22: After morning worship, the deity of the Ramallah will be consecrated in Mrigashira Nakshatra in the afternoon. As Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya on December 30, the city is to come under a blanket of heightened security, police said on Friday. PM Modi during his visit to Ayodhya will inaugurate various projects worth Rs 15,000 crore. UP Minister Jaiveer Singh who is among the group of State Ministers overseeing preparation says that Saturday will be a big day for Sanatan Dharma. "Tomorrow is going to be a big day not just for the people of Uttar Pradesh but also for all the believers of Sanatana Dharma... Ayodhya airport is being named after Maharshi Valmiki, who personified Lord Ram and gave new dimensions to our culture...Ayodhya Dham railway station will also be inaugurated tomorrow after renovation in which many trains will be flagged off... Projects worth thousands of crores will be inaugurated tomorrow by Prime Minister Modi and we heartily welcome him to our state" Jaiveer Singh. Piyush Mordia, Additional Director General of Police, Lucknow Zone said that high-level arrangements meeting the recruitments of PM's security have been made ahead of the Prime Minister's visit to the district adding that Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and National Security Guards (NSG) among other security forces have been deployed. He said that a rehearsal of PM Modi's roadshow will be done today to oversee the arrangements. "We are monitoring all areas with drones. To improve the traffic system, a traffic diversion plan has also been made," the ADG said.
